perturbation.original_text:
This amendment to Section 2 (titled "Term"), Part B of the Co-Branding
Agreement is made effective December 9, 1996 by and between PC Quote, Inc.
(hereinafter referred to as "PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc. (hereinafter
referred to as "ABW"), who are also the parties contracted in the
aforementioned Co-Branding Agreement. This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ
and ABW and all of their subsidiaries and related companies.
perturbation.changed_text:
This amendment to Section 2 (titled "Term"), Part B of the Co-Branding
Agreement is made effective December 9, 1996 by and between PC Quote, Inc.
(hereinafter referred to as "PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc. (hereinafter
referred to as "ABW"), who are also the parties contracted in the
aforementioned Co-Branding Agreement. This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ
and ABW only.
perturbation.explanation: By removing "and all of their subsidiaries and related companies," the amendment potentially limits the liability and obligations of the parent companies regarding the actions of their subsidiaries. This contradicts the principle of corporate veil piercing, which, under certain circumstances, allows courts to hold parent companies liable for the actions of their subsidiaries, particularly in cases of fraud or undercapitalization. Omitting this extension of the agreement introduces legal risk by suggesting the subsidiaries are not bound, which may not be legally accurate.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles related to corporate veil piercing and parent company liability under US corporate law.

perturbation.explanation: Omitting the dates of signature (Date: 12/5/96 and Date: 12/12/96) creates ambiguity regarding the effective execution and acceptance of the amendment. This contradicts basic contract law principles requiring a clear record of when the agreement was finalized and agreed upon. Without these dates, establishing the validity and enforceability of the agreement may be challenged, creating legal risk. In many jurisdictions, statutes of limitations begin running from the date of the agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Basic principles of contract law related to offer, acceptance, and execution of agreements.
